abstract.text: An object that defines the drawing characteristics (width, color, pen style) to use when drawing lines on a canvas view.

inlineContent.text: object supports the creation of new content on a
. With an inking tool, the canvas turns touch input from the user into a continuously rendered stroke. The value in the
property determines the base width of that stroke; however, that base value also depends on input from Apple Pencil, including force, azimuth, and angle data.
Create an inking tool programmatically, or display a
object and from which a user can select a tool. Assign the resulting object to the
object. The canvas uses any subsequent touch sequences to draw new content on the canvas. Assigning a new inking tool doesnâ€™t change the characteristics for any previously drawn strokes.

abstract.text: Capture touch and Apple Pencil input as a drawing, and display that content from your app.
A view that captures Apple Pencil input and displays the rendered results in an iOS app.
The currently selected tool used for drawing.
A tool for erasing previously drawn content in a canvas view.
The type that defines the shape of stroked lines.
An inking tool that creates the appearance of a crayon.
An inking tool that creates the appearance of a calligraphy pen.
An inking tool that creates the appearance of a felt-tip marker.
An inking tool that creates the appearance of a monoline pen.
An inking tool that creates the appearance of drawing with a pen.
An inking tool that creates the appearance of drawing with a pencil.
An inking tool that creates the appearance of a watercolor brush.
A structure that defines the drawing characteristics (width, color, pen style) to use when drawing lines on a canvas view.
An object that defines the drawing characteristics (width, color, pen style) to use when drawing lines on a canvas view.
The color of the ink.
Converts a color from one user interface style to another.
Returns the default line width for the specified tool type.
Create an inking tool with the specified ink and width.
Creates an ink tool object with the default line width and the specified color.
Creates an ink tool object with the specified color and line width values.
The ink that this tool creates strokes with.
The tool type that determines the shape of the rendered content.
Returns the maximum allowed line width for the specified tool type.
Returns the minimum allowed line width for the specified tool type.
The version of PencilKit necessary to use the inking tool.
The base line width for new content.
A tool for selecting stroked lines and shapes in a canvas view.
An abstract base class for tools used by a canvas view.
A tool palette that displays a selection of drawing tools and colors for tools that a person can choose from.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
